trans-unit.source: Availability of Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Availability of Hadoop clusters in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: HDInsight deploys highly available and reliable clusters with an addtional head node.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight deploys highly available and reliable clusters with an addtional head node.

trans-unit.source: Availability and reliability of Hadoop clusters in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Availability and reliability of Hadoop clusters in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: HDInsight allows customers to deploy a variety of cluster types, for different data analytics workloads.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight allows customers to deploy a variety of cluster types, for different data analytics workloads.

trans-unit.source: Cluster types offered today are Hadoop clusters for query and analysis workloads, HBase clusters for NoSQL workloads, and Storm clusters for real time event processing workloads.
trans-unit.target: Cluster types offered today are Hadoop clusters for query and analysis workloads, HBase clusters for NoSQL workloads, and Storm clusters for real time event processing workloads.

trans-unit.source: Within a given cluster type, there are different roles for the various nodes.
trans-unit.target: Within a given cluster type, there are different roles for the various nodes.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight are deployed with two roles:
trans-unit.target: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight are deployed with two roles:

trans-unit.source: Head node (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head node (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Data node (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Data node (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: HBase clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:
trans-unit.target: HBase clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:

trans-unit.source: Head servers (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head servers (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Region servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Region servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Storm clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:
trans-unit.target: Storm clusters for HDInsight are deployed with three roles:

trans-unit.source: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Standard implementations of Hadoop clusters typically have a single head node.
trans-unit.target: Standard implementations of Hadoop clusters typically have a single head node.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight removes this single point of failure with the addition of a secondary head node /head server/Nimbus node to increase the availability and reliability of the service needed to manage workloads.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight removes this single point of failure with the addition of a secondary head node /head server/Nimbus node to increase the availability and reliability of the service needed to manage workloads.

trans-unit.source: These head nodes/head servers/Nimbus nodes are designed to manage the failure of worker nodes smoothly, but any outages of master services running on the head node would cause the cluster to cease to work.
trans-unit.target: These head nodes/head servers/Nimbus nodes are designed to manage the failure of worker nodes smoothly, but any outages of master services running on the head node would cause the cluster to cease to work.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>ZooKeeper</linkText><title></title></link> nodes (ZKs) have been added and are used for leader election of head nodes and to insure that worker nodes and gateways (GWs) know when to fail over to the secondary head node (Head Node1) when the active head node (Head Node0) becomes inactive.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>ZooKeeper</linkText><title></title></link> nodes (ZKs) have been added and are used for leader election of head nodes and to insure that worker nodes and gateways (GWs) know when to fail over to the secondary head node (Head Node1) when the active head node (Head Node0) becomes inactive.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Diagram of the highly reliable head nodes in the HDInsight Hadoop implementation.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Diagram of the highly reliable head nodes in the HDInsight Hadoop implementation.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Check the active head node service status
trans-unit.target: Check the active head node service status

trans-unit.source: To determine which head node is active and to check on the status of the services running on that head node, you must connect to the Hadoop cluster by using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).
trans-unit.target: To determine which head node is active and to check on the status of the services running on that head node, you must connect to the Hadoop cluster by using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).

trans-unit.source: For the RDP instructions, see <link><linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For the RDP instructions, see <link><linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Once you have remoted into the cluster, double-click on the *Hadoop Service Available * icon located on the desktop to obtain status about which head node the Namenode, Jobtracker, Templeton, Oozieservice, Metastore, and Hiveserver2 services are running, or for HDI 3.0, the Namenode, Resource Manager, History Server, Templeton, Oozieservice, Metastore, and Hiveserver2 services.
trans-unit.target: Once you have remoted into the cluster, double-click on the *Hadoop Service Available * icon located on the desktop to obtain status about which head node the Namenode, Jobtracker, Templeton, Oozieservice, Metastore, and Hiveserver2 services are running, or for HDI 3.0, the Namenode, Resource Manager, History Server, Templeton, Oozieservice, Metastore, and Hiveserver2 services.

trans-unit.source: On the screenshot, the active head node is headnode0.
trans-unit.target: On the screenshot, the active head node is headnode0.

trans-unit.source: Access log files on the secondary head node
trans-unit.target: Access log files on the secondary head node

trans-unit.source: To access job logs on the secondary head node in the event that it has become the active head node, browsing the JobTracker UI still works as it does for the primary active node.
trans-unit.target: To access job logs on the secondary head node in the event that it has become the active head node, browsing the JobTracker UI still works as it does for the primary active node.

trans-unit.source: To access JobTracker, you must connect to the Hadoop cluster by using RDP as described in the previous section.
trans-unit.target: To access JobTracker, you must connect to the Hadoop cluster by using RDP as described in the previous section.

trans-unit.source: Once you have remoted into the cluster, double-click on the Hadoop Name Node Status icon located on the desktop and then click on the NameNode logs to get to the directory of logs on the secondary head node.
trans-unit.target: Once you have remoted into the cluster, double-click on the Hadoop Name Node Status icon located on the desktop and then click on the NameNode logs to get to the directory of logs on the secondary head node.

trans-unit.source: Configure the size of the head node
trans-unit.target: Configure the size of the head node

trans-unit.source: The head nodes are allocated as large virtual machines (VMs) by default.
trans-unit.target: The head nodes are allocated as large virtual machines (VMs) by default.

trans-unit.source: This size is adequate for the management of most Hadoop jobs run on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This size is adequate for the management of most Hadoop jobs run on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: But there are scenarios that may require extra-large VMs for the head nodes.
trans-unit.target: But there are scenarios that may require extra-large VMs for the head nodes.

trans-unit.source: One example is when the cluster has to manage a large number of small Oozie jobs.
trans-unit.target: One example is when the cluster has to manage a large number of small Oozie jobs.

trans-unit.source: Extra-large VMs can be configured by using either Azure PowerShell cmdlets or the HDInsight SDK.
trans-unit.target: Extra-large VMs can be configured by using either Azure PowerShell cmdlets or the HDInsight SDK.

trans-unit.source: The creation and provisioning of a cluster by using Azure PowerShell is documented in <link><linkText>Administer HDInsight using PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The creation and provisioning of a cluster by using Azure PowerShell is documented in <link><linkText>Administer HDInsight using PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The configuration of an extra-large head node requires the addition of the -HeadNodeVMSize ExtraLarge parameter to the New-AzureHDInsightcluster cmdlet used in this code.
trans-unit.target: The configuration of an extra-large head node requires the addition of the -HeadNodeVMSize ExtraLarge parameter to the New-AzureHDInsightcluster cmdlet used in this code.

trans-unit.source: For the SDK, the story is similar.
trans-unit.target: For the SDK, the story is similar.

trans-unit.source: The creation and provisioning of a cluster by using the SDK is documented in <link><linkText>Using HDInsight .NET SDK</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The creation and provisioning of a cluster by using the SDK is documented in <link><linkText>Using HDInsight .NET SDK</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The configuration of an extra-large head node requires the addition of the HeadNodeSize = NodeVMSize.ExtraLarge parameter to the ClusterCreateParameters() method used in this code.
trans-unit.target: The configuration of an extra-large head node requires the addition of the HeadNodeSize = NodeVMSize.ExtraLarge parameter to the ClusterCreateParameters() method used in this code.
